intro: Gutenbergia spermacoceoides, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white, tubular flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, black, elliptical fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Gutenbergia spermacoceoides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
